quiz.subtitle: Vector Addition Basics - Graphical and Mathematical Methods (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: When adding vectors graphically using the head-to-tail method, the resultant vector is drawn from:
options: Head of first to head of last
Tail of first to tail of last
Tail of first to head of last
Head of first to tail of last
questions.explanation: In the head-to-tail method, you place vectors sequentially, then draw the resultant from the tail of the first to the head of the last.

questions.question: Two forces act on an object: 5 N east and 12 N east. The resultant force is:
questions.explanation: Forces in the same direction add directly: 5 N + 12 N = 17 N east.

questions.question: Two forces act on an object: 8 N north and 6 N south. The resultant force is:
questions.explanation: Opposite directions subtract: 8 N - 6 N = 2 N in the direction of the larger force (north).

questions.question: A boat travels 4 km east, then 3 km north. What is the magnitude of its displacement?
A vector with magnitude 10 units at 30° above the horizontal has a horizontal component of approximately:
questions.explanation: Horizontal component = magnitude × cos θ = 10 × cos 30° = 10 × 0.866 = 8.66 ≈ 8.7 units.

questions.question: A vector with magnitude 10 units at 30° above the horizontal has a vertical component of approximately:
questions.explanation: Vertical component = magnitude × sin θ = 10 × sin 30° = 10 × 0.5 = 5.0 units.

questions.question: Two perpendicular vectors have magnitudes 6 units and 8 units. The magnitude of their resultant is:
questions.explanation: For perpendicular vectors, R = √(A² + B²) = √(6² + 8²) = √(36 + 64) = √100 = 10 units.

questions.question: A hiker walks 10 km east, then 10 km south. The direction of the resultant displacement is:
questions.explanation: East then south places the resultant in the southeast quadrant.

questions.question: Which of the following vector combinations will yield the largest resultant magnitude?
options: Two 5 N forces at 90° to each other
Two 5 N forces in the same direction
Two 5 N forces in opposite directions
Two 5 N forces at 180° to each other
questions.explanation: Same direction gives maximum addition: 5 + 5 = 10 N. Perpendicular gives √(25+25) = 7.07 N. Opposite gives 0 N.

questions.question: A vector has components Ax = 3 units east and Ay = 4 units north. The magnitude and direction of this vector are:
questions.explanation: Magnitude = √(3² + 4²) = √25 = 5 units. Direction is northeast since both components are positive.
